Package com.metal.kit.vapor.characters

Class Character

java.lang.Object
com.metal.kit.vapor.characters.Character
All Implemented Interfaces:
Playable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, Player
public abstract class Character extends Object implements Playable
Represents a character in the game. This abstract class provides basic functionalities such as managing health points, attack power, and texture handling. It is intended to be extended by specific character classes (e.g., the player or enemy).

This class implements the Playable interface, which defines movement and attack methods. Movement and attack behaviors are left to the subclasses because each character type can have different behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • Character

      public Character(String name, float x, float y, int hp, int attackPower, float speed)
      Constructs a character with basic parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - The character's name.
      x - The initial X position of the character.
      y - The initial Y position of the character.
      hp - The initial health points of the character.
      attackPower - The attack power of the character.
      speed - The movement speed of the character.

  • Method Details

    • initTexture

      public void initTexture(String idleTexturePath, String runningTexturePath, int nbOfFrames)
      Initializes the textures and animations for the character, using paths to the texture files. This method sets up both the idle and running animations.
      Parameters:
      idleTexturePath - The path to the idle texture.
      runningTexturePath - The path to the running texture.
      nbOfFrames - The number of frames for each animation (idle and running).

    • move

      public void move(float delta, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map)
      Moves the character based on delta coordinates. The movement logic is left to subclasses.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Playable
      Parameters:
      delta - The distance to move (time-based).
      map - The game map (used for collision detection and terrain).

    • attack

      public void attack(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Enemy> enemies, com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Sound shootSound)
      Performs an attack on enemies. The method is left to subclasses to define specific attack behavior.
      Specified by:
      attack in interface Playable
      Parameters:
      enemies - A list of enemies that can be attacked.
      shootSound - The sound to play when the character attacks.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Takes damage from an attack. If the health points drop to zero or below, the die() method is called.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Playable
      Parameters:
      damage - The amount of damage dealt to the character.

    • die

      public void die()
      This method is called when the character's health reaches zero. It can be used to perform actions when the character dies, such as displaying a message or triggering an animation.
      Specified by:
      die in interface Playable

    • update

      public void update(float delta, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map)
      Updates the state of the character. This method can be used to handle animations or other gameplay logic. The update logic is left to subclasses.
      Parameters:
      delta - The time elapsed since the last update.
      map - The game map.

    • render

      public void render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
      Draws the character on the screen using a SpriteBatch.
      Parameters:
      batch - The SpriteBatch used to render the character.

      Releases resources used by the character, such as textures and other graphical objects.

    • getTexture

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture getTexture()
      Returns the current texture used to render the character. If the character is running, the running texture is returned, otherwise the idle texture.
      Returns:
      The texture used to render the character.
